block.p: Suzanne Carol McElfresh and Alan David Light, editors in New York, are to be married today by Rabbi Hirshel Jaffe at West Park Wine Cellars, a vineyard in West Park, N.Y.
The bride is the executive editor of Trackers.net, a Web site for young women that is owned by Oxygen Media; the bridegroom is the editor in chief of Spin, the music magazine.
Suzanne Carol McElfresh and Alan David Light, editors in New York, are to be married today by Rabbi Hirshel Jaffe at West Park Wine Cellars, a vineyard in West Park, N.Y.
The bride is the executive editor of Trackers.net, a Web site for young women that is owned by Oxygen Media; the bridegroom is the editor in chief of Spin, the music magazine.

Ms. McElfresh, 40, is keeping her name. She graduated from Arizona State University. She is the daughter of Patricia Myers and Gerald McElfresh, both of Scottsdale, Ariz., and the stepdaughter of Robin McElfresh. The bride's father retired as a bureau chief for The Arizona Republic, a daily newspaper in Phoenix. Her mother, a former food editor at The Republic, is a freelance writer.

Mr. Light, 33, graduated cum laude from Yale University. He is the son of Janet Light and Dr. Irwin J. Light of Cincinnati. His mother is a freelance writer and dance critic. His father is a professor of pediatrics and of obstetrics and gynecology at the University of Cincinnati. He is also the chairman of the human research ethics committee at the Children's Hospital Medical Center in Cincinnati.
